page.title: 12THE SCHOOL IN QUEEN CAMEL
page.content: Countess Gytha Primary school in Queen Camel serves an area of about 16 square miles. School starts at 9.10 am and finishes at 3.30 pm. There is a lunch break from 12.00 to 1.15 when the majority of children eat packed lunches, although school meals are available. Mid-morning milk is also provided at 8p a day. At the end of the day most children travel home on contract buses. These are free to any infants living further than 2 miles from the school and to juniors further than 3 miles. The oldest school building dates back to 1872. The school has a heated outdoor swimming pool which each class uses daily. The school has a friendly family-like atmosphere. The staff are popular but strict.
